intro: Moraea carnea, commonly known as the pink moraea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. It produces narrow, grass-like leaves and has a short, thick rhizome. Moraea carnea is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its vibrant blooms.
